page.title: 01GENERAL SUMMARY
page.content: The area is very rural,lying about 3 miles NE of Carlisle and having really only 3 settlements of any size.These are the villages of HOUGHTON,LINSTOCK and BRUNSTOCK.The countryside is good farmland,mostly pasture or grazing land and supporting a number of quite large dairy farms. In our area the largest farm (Linstock) is about 1100 acres but others are 5_600 acres.Most animals are bought and sold in nearby Carlisle,an important market town and agricultural centre. Industry other than farming is minimal,but some tourists come looking for the route of Hadrians Wall which crosses the area.The M6 motorway slices through the area and the R.Eden meanders across one corner.This quiet rural area has few amenities but is unspoilt and even deer roam freely.
